Key Match Events: Papua New Guinea recover from 50-4 to post 136-8
Andre Russell steered the Windies ship home
Roston Chase turned it on when he needed to - four fours and two sixes in his unbeaten 42
Pre-Game Insights: Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala: "It was a competitive score but we believe we missed a trick at the end, another 10 or 15 runs would've been nice"
West Indies captain Rovman Powell: "Credit to PNG, their plans were simple and they played good cricket"
Roland Butcher: "The lack of preparation has a huge effect. If West Indies were playing a stronger team they'd have lost that game"
Jason: "Credit to PNG: stayed in the game, but Windies bat deep"
Geraint Jones: "Papua New Guinea can be proud. They should be really happy with that start and they can take a lot of confidence into other games"
Simon Mann: "Papua New Guinea have had a good day out. They've pushed the hosts and one of the tournament favourites hard"
Post-Match Reflections: Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala: "It's an opportunity and a challenge we look forward to"
West Indies captain Rovman Powell: "We gave them 10-15 runs too much and we will look to tighten up when bowling"
Roston Chase: "I'm very pleased. It is always good to start the tournament with a win and I'm glad I was able to do that for the team"
Roland Butcher: "They've got superstar players but they are not a team, they are just a group of good players"
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on 2 June 2024
The next match for West Indies is against Uganda on Saturday
The top two teams from each group will make it through to the next round
Papua New Guinea can take a lot of confidence into their next games
